intro: Turetta racemosa, commonly known as the racemose turetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a smooth margin and a reddish hue on the underside. Turetta racemosa is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
